data.title: Show live ping times of players during gameplay
data.body: Often times the game lags or freezes and there is no way of telling which player is causing this. It would be nice to see the current ping times of each user in the statistics window or at the corner of the screen as an option.

data.title: Show disconnected players in the game
data.body: In the statistics window, it is not possible to see who is still in the game and who has disconnected. The ones that have surrendered or were defeated are shown but people who have disconnected are not marked.

data.title: Demolishing with Tanya causes crash
data.body:
Crash pointed me to C4Demolition.cs line 54. "order.TargetActor" is null.
Exception: "Object reference not set to an instance of an object."

I tried ordering Tanya to demolish an enemy refinery, and it instantly crashed. The refinery was partly covered in fog.

data.title: BuildLimit Bug With Chrono on Tanya in a jeep
data.body:
Using Chronosphere on a Jeep that has Tanya inside it causes Tanya to disappear from the jeep and she cannot be rebuilt for the rest of the game.

Recreation of the bug:
http://youtu.be/kBsL0xu8LkE

data.title: Issue4547
data.body:
Sorry about the re-post, I made a mistake with Github's native app.
This fixes #4547. Requested changes have been added.

data.title: C# Express VS 2010 does not support solution folders
data.body: One of the recent merges damaged compatibility with VS 2010 Express Edition. Not really sure what else to add.

data.title: Added RAED tile ID 0 support
data.body: The game will crash when loading/converting legacy maps created with http://cnc.wikia.com/wiki/RAED. See http://cnc-comm.com/community/index.php?topic=2727.0

data.title: Problem with my flicking screen
data.body:
Look at the youtube  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t-SvZdJ2xSw   this is my problem.
My screen flicking in the game.

Pls can you help me?

Thank you

data.title: Issue4547
data.body:
First of, sorry for the spelling in the commit messages.
This is a fix for the issue #4547, and now a player's units and allied units will get notified when blocking a unit, and will be nudged. Both move commands and production buildings inform units of blocking.

data.title: Exception of type `System.Net.Sockets.SocketException`: An attempt was made to access a socket in a way forbidden by its access permissions
data.body: Hey Guys, I can launch the game fine but after i click create game and try to launch it this is what i get in the exception file log, any ideas how to fix it?, I'm sadly not tech savvy :(

data.title: AI should make use of oil derricks
data.body:
Currently AI players ignore capturable oil derricks. Capturing these should be prioritised from the start. When oil derricks are available and ore is limited or unavailable, AI players should not build multiple refineries. Small teams of infantry and light vehicles could be assembled to escort the engineers or their transports, and then guard the captured derricks. An AI-owned derrick under attack should cause the AI to send support units and repair it if damaged.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1398351-ai-should-make-use-of-oil-derricks?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Add map type descriptions
data.body:
In the map selector, users currently have no way of knowing what changes between map types such as conquest, drop zone and king of the hill. Add a short line of text either above or below the map selection area giving the title and a short description of the currently selected map type. The map type selector should be located near this text.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1398213-add-map-type-descriptions?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Add presets for team colours
data.body:
In the game lobby, colours are currently assigned randomly when players and bots are added. This can result in teams whose colours are similar. I propose adding a selection of preset colours to the colour dropdown menu, in addition to a custom option as is currently used.

When a new team is added, its colour should be chosen randomly from the list. Colours already in use should be removed from the list. When no more preset colours are available, the colour of any subsequent teams should be chosen randomly as is done currently. The preset colours should be mod-specific to best showcase that mod's visual aesthetic.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

data.title: Unselectable Walls
data.body: Squashed and fixed up #4544

data.title: Pseudo-Fullscreen to Fullscreen and now its just a black screen
data.body:
Is there anyway I can change the settings manually? an .ini file or something?
Seems like the game is running, I can hear audio but the screen is black.

Edit: Found the Settings.yaml file in the "%USERPROFILE%\Documents\OpenRA\" folder.
Been saving the file with a "Screen: Pseudo-Fullscreen" line under Graphics and it seemed to work the first time but every time I quit and come back its black screen again. Deleting the file doesn't seem to generate a default file or anything.

data.title: Select units by type
data.body: Adds #4551: Selecting of all units matching the current type across the screen or map using Ctrl + T.

data.title: Current bleed (6f36173) allows setting stances on aircraft
Game crash when exitting online play. (ArgumentException, duplicate values found for keys)
data.body:
I was online playing a 'temperate' 3v3 map (can't remember which) when just after being defeated and clicking on disconnect, the game crashes throwing a `System.ArgumentException` exception.

Link to full stacktrace: http://pastebin.com/nfeTsQ8w   

 Saved log files if any other one is needed.

data.title: Edge of map resources
Reduce helicopter pushing
data.body:
Groups of helicopters moving through the position of another helicopter will push this helicopter with them to their destination. Ideally, the group should flow around the obstructing helicopter, the obstructing helicopter should move out of the way, or the obstructing helicopter should path back to its starting point when moved.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1397623-reduce-helicopter-pushing?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Select units by type
data.body: Implement a button or keyboard shortcut which selects all units on the screen which are of the same type as the units currently selected. If all units of the selected type are already selected, select across the whole map. "Selected across screen" or "Selected across map" should be displayed at the bottom of the screen. This matches the behaviour in TS and RA2.

data.title: Normal users do not see incompatible games, show them other mods
data.body: When players browse the game list, they need to click incompatible (it does not remember from last time btw.), to be able to view other installed mods games. This leads to players thinking that mods are not installed, and that its not possible for them to join. Before we make autochange mod, then I want: "mods with open servers and players waiting: "d2k,starwars Mod,etc"

data.title: Implement unit priority for rearm and repair
data.body:
When sending a group of units to repair or rearm at a service depot, helipad or airfield, priority should be given to units with the greatest need of the structure (heavily damaged, no remaining amunition), followed by those closest to it. Currently, a group of heavily damaged units around the a service depot may wait for a fully repaired unit to arrive from some distance away.

data.title: Make paratroopers wait for ground contact before picking up crates
data.body:
Currently paratroopers pick up crates the moment they spawn above the cell. This allows them to avoid the effects of negative crates such as napalm.
